app.components.AnalysisShortcut.text_gro: Identify other functional groups of same biome by area

app.components.Disclaimer.disclaimer: Please note that the content and functionality of this site are still under development.

app.components.GroupDiagram.caption: {title} - Ecological Traits & Key Ecological Drivers
app.components.NavGridChildren.biomesSel: Select a biome to learn more
app.components.NavGridChildren.biomesTit: The {no} {no, select, 1 {biome} other {biomes}} of the {parent} realm
app.components.NavGridChildren.groupsSel: Select a functional group to learn more
app.components.NavGridChildren.groupsTit: The {no} functional {no, select, 1 {group} other {groups}} of the {parent}
app.components.Tooltip.mapAttributionGro: Compiled by RLE from various sources. See group descriptions for detailed references
app.components.Tooltip.mapAttributionReg: Country boundaries adapted from 'World Bank Official Boundaries' (consulted on 2021-05-03)
Marine regions adapted from 'Pope, Addy. (2017). Large Marine Ecosystems of the World' (consulted on 2021-05-04)
app.components.Tooltip.occurrenceIntro: Distribution areas of ecosystem functional groups have been classified as major or minor occurrences
app.components.Tooltip.occurrence_major: Major occurrences are areas where an ecosystem functional group is very likely to occur
app.components.Tooltip.occurrence_minor: Minor occurrences are areas where an ecosystem functional group is scattered in patches within matrices of other ecosystem functional groups or where they occur in substantial areas but only within a segment of a larger region
app.containers.Map.drawTooltipEdit: Drag handles to edit, then 'Save' to update area
app.containers.Map.drawTooltipPolygonEnd: Click to add points or click first point to close area
app.containers.Map.drawTooltipRectangleS: Click and drag to draw rectangular area
app.containers.Map.drawTooltipRemove: Click on area, then 'Save' to delete area
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.awaitResults: Retrieving list of ecosystem groups... Especially for large areas this may take a while.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.defineAreaFi: A comma-separated list of points, each consisting of two space-separated values in decimal degrees where the first value represents the point's latitude and the second value its longitude (format: 'lon1 lat1,lon2 lat2,[...],lon3 lat3'). Note that the last point must equal the first point to 'close' the resulting shape.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.defineAreaIn: Draw an area on the map or enter area coordinates
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.download: For additional analyses you can download the raw data from the {link}.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.hintResultsA: Note that the retrieved list is intended to be indicative only.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.hintResultsG: Bars showing % of global occurrence for each type
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.hintResultsR: Note that the retrieved list is intended to be indicative only. Further note that the area calculation is still experimental and has some limitations.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.intro: Retrieve an indicative list of ecosystem functional groups for a given area.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.noRegionsFou: Sorry no regions matched your search
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.noResults: We are sorry, but your query produced no results. Please try again with a different area or different filter settings
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.selectRegion: Select a region on the map or from the dropdown
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.submitQueryN: Query requires defining a closed area
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.title: Functional Groups by Area
app.containers.RouteExploreOverview.teas: Start by selecting a Realm of interest, then drill down to learn more about its Biomes and Ecosystem Functional Groups
app.containers.RouteHome.introParagraph: The IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology is a comprehensive classification framework for Earthâ€™s ecosystems that integrates their functional and compositional features. This typology has been adopted by several internacional institution to help identify the ecosystems that are most critical for biodiversity conservation, research, management and human wellbeing into the future.
app.containers.RouteHome.teaserSectionAb: This site is an introduction to the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology
app.containers.RouteHome.teaserSectionAn: Identify occurrence of functional groups by country or custom area
app.containers.RouteHome.teaserSectionEx: Start by selecting a Realm of interest, then drill down to learn more about its Biomes and Ecosystem Functional Groups
app.containers.Search.noResults: We are sorry! Your search did not return any results.
app.containers.Search.placeholder: Search typology by name or id
app.containers.Search.resultHint: Search typology by name or id
rle.containers.CookieConsent.info: By using this Website you agree to store some of your Personal Data where it is essential for the Website to function. In addition, you can enable non-essential third-party services that may store Cookies and Usage Data
